content: That's really helpful! I think I'll create a balance of colors and textures on the table, and use garnishes like thinly sliced daikon and shiso leaves to add some freshness. I'll also use small pedestals to create different levels on the table and make the arrangement more visually appealing. For the centerpiece, I'll use a beautiful ceramic vase with some Japanese-inspired decorations. Do you have any suggestions on how to label or sign the different dishes, so my guests know what they're eating?
